FuncDef:
The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise default routes to a peer group.
The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default configuration. The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise default routes to a peer group. The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default configuration. By default, a BGP device does not advertise any default route to its peer group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a peer group.
The name is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, with spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo: In an ORF scenario, if a device that does not support ORF exists on the network, you can configure the device to advertise ORF default routes to a peer group in the BGP-VPN-Target address family view to establish an ORF peer relationship.
